decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to efficiently dump cards into the graveyard, trigger dredge abilities to return key creatures to the battlefield, and then use cards like Conflagrate to deal damage to the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to quickly fill the graveyard, while cards like Life from the Loam help with graveyard recursion. Prized Amalgam, Golgari Grave-Troll, and other dredge creatures work together to create a combo-based strategy that overwhelms opponents with a constant stream of threats from the graveyard.

The key strategy of this deck revolves around quickly building up poison counters on your opponent through the infect mechanic. By using efficient pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Become Immense, as well as protective spells like Vines of Vastwood and Blossoming Defense, you aim to overwhelm your opponent with a flurry of infect damage from creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf. The deck includes disruptive spells like Twisted Image and Apostle's Blessing to help maintain momentum and protect your threats while racing towards victory.

The deck focuses on a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells to put pressure on the opponent while controlling the board. By utilizing efficient removal like Path to Exile and Abrupt Decay alongside hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, the deck can clear the path for its threats like Tarmogoyf, Scavenging Ooze, and Siege Rhino. Lingering Souls provides additional value and resilience, while planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope offer versatile tools to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is built around efficiently casting its spells and activating key utility lands like Shambling Vent and Gavony Township.

The main concept of this Modern Infect deck is to use fast, evasive creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent to deal infect damage to the opponent and win the game quickly. The deck also includes pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Might of Old Krosa to enhance the power of these creatures, along with protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Blossoming Defense to keep them safe. The deck aims to assemble a lethal combination of creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory through this aggressive infect strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly and efficiently reanimating powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Borborygmos Enraged using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Through the Breach. By utilizing cards like Nourishing Shoal and Simian Spirit Guide, the deck is able to play these expensive creatures much earlier than normal, allowing for explosive and game-winning plays. The inclusion of draw and discard spells like Faithless Looting and Night's Whisper helps to find key combo pieces quickly, making this deck a formidable force in a Modern format.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, dealing damage efficiently and consistently. By utilizing fast mana sources and efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Additionally, cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel punish opponents for casting spells, further increasing the pressure on the opponent. Overall, this deck aims to win the game quickly through aggressive attacking and burn spells before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck revolves around using the Ad Nauseam combo to draw cards and win the game. By casting Ad Nauseam with Angel's Grace to prevent losing life, the player can draw their entire library, play Laboratory Maniac, and win by drawing a card with an empty library. The deck includes ways to generate mana quickly and protect the combo with Pact of Negation. This deck aims to assemble the combo as fast as possible, while carefully managing life total and resources to ensure victory.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent through an affinity strategy. The deck focuses on playing low-cost artifacts like Memnite, Ornithopter, and Signal Pest to quickly build a board presence. This is further supported by cards like Arcbound Ravager, Steel Overseer, and Vault Skirge, which boost the power of the artifacts or provide additional threats. The deck also uses cards like Galvanic Blast and Cranial Plating to deal damage and secure the win. The inclusion of Etched Champion and Master of Etherium adds resilience and power to the deck. The manabase consists of lands like Glimmervoid, Darksteel Citadel, Blinkmoth Nexus, and Inkmoth Nexus, which help generate the necessary colored mana and provide versatility.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with powerful Dredge creatures and spells, allowing you to recur them easily and overwhelm your opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting to discard cards and dredge spells like Life from the Loam and Stinkweed Imp, you can constantly bring back creatures like Narcomoeba, Bloodghast, and Prized Amalgam to put immense pressure on your opponent and win the game through sheer graveyard recursion.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures early in the game, backed up by disruption spells like Path to Exile and Thought-Knot Seer to control the opponent's board. The mana base is designed to support the Eldrazi creatures while also providing access to various colors for spells like Engineered Explosives and Dismember. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Reality Smasher and Drowner of Hope, while also utilizing cards like Eldrazi Displacer for added utility and synergy with other creatures in the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly pump up low-cost infect creatures, such as Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf, with powerful pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent and win the game. The deck also includes protection spells like Apostle's Blessing and Vines of Vastwood to protect your creatures from removal spells. The mana base is optimized to consistently be able to cast your spells and activate Inkmoth Nexus for additional infect damage.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient removal spells and disruptive hand disruption to control the opponent's resources while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Liliana of the Veil to apply pressure and grind out value. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's black, red, and green spells, allowing for flexibility in casting spells as needed. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression, disruption, and card advantage to secure a victory in the mid to late game.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly assemble aggressive creatures like Kiln Fiend and Monastery Swiftspear, supported by pump spells and protection like Mutagenic Growth and Apostle's Blessing. The deck aims to combo off with cheap spells like Manamorphose and Lightning Bolt to enable explosive turns and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of disruptive elements like Thing in the Ice and Vapor Snag helps to keep the opponent on their back foot while the deck goes for the win.

The main concept of this deck is to control the opponent's deck by using cards like Lantern of Insight and Codex Shredder to manipulate their draws. The deck aims to prevent the opponent from drawing cards they need while also disrupting their game plan through cards like Pithing Needle and Abrupt Decay. The deck also utilizes Ensnaring Bridge to limit the opponent's ability to attack. Additionally, the deck has various options for disruption and removal with cards like Thoughtseize, Surgical Extraction, and Collective Brutality. The deck also includes artifacts like Mox Opal and Inventors' Fair for mana acceleration and card searching.

The main goal of this deck is to control the game by disrupting opponents' strategies with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek, Thoughtseize, and Surgical Extraction, while locking them out of playing their cards using Ensnaring Bridge and Lantern of Insight. The deck utilizes artifacts like Codex Shredder and Ghoulcaller's Bell to manipulate the top of opponents' libraries and prevent them from drawing useful cards. Mox Opal provides mana acceleration to play multiple cards in a turn, and the deck also includes cards like Abrupt Decay and Glint-Nest Crane for additional disruption and card advantage.

The deck relies heavily on artifacts to quickly swarm the board with low-cost creatures and boost their power with equipment. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive playstyle, utilizing cards like Cranial Plating and Galvanic Blast to deal fast, efficient damage. The inclusion of cards like Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager allow for additional synergies and ways to buff up your creatures. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main concept of this Dredge deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards using cards like Faithless Looting, Cathartic Reunion, and Life from the Loam, and then to utilize the Dredge mechanic to return creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll, Stinkweed Imp, Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam from the graveyard to the battlefield. This aggressive strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful combo of creatures, dealing damage quickly and efficiently. Additionally, cards like Conflagrate and Scourge Devil provide additional reach and finishing power.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to ramp up quickly using cards like Noble Hierarch and Eldrazi Temple to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer as early as possible. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Path to Exile and Dismember to control the board while maintaining aggressive pressure. With the help of cards like Eldrazi Displacer and Spellskite, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures, utilizing a mix of mana acceleration, disruption, and powerful threats to achieve victory.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures while utilizing Eldrazi Temple and other lands to ramp up quickly. It also includes disruption in the form of Path to Exile and Thought-Knot Seer to control the opponent's board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and powerful creatures like Reality Smasher and Drowner of Hope, while also providing some protection with cards like Spellskite. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the Eldrazi creatures while also incorporating mana acceleration with Noble Hierarch and other ramp spells.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Kiln Fiend and Monastery Swiftspear, while using cheap spells like Manamorphose and Gitaxian Probe to trigger their abilities and pump them up. With cards like Temur Battle Rage and Mutagenic Growth, the aim is to deal massive amounts of damage in a short amount of time and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thing in the Ice and Vapor Snag to disrupt opponents' strategies and clear the way for attacks.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly build up a board presence with fast and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Thing in the Ice, and Kiln Fiend, while utilizing cheap spells like Manamorphose and Mutagenic Growth to pump them up and deal massive damage. The deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells like Lightning Bolt, while also utilizing card draw and filtering effects like Serum Visions and Gitaxian Probe to maintain consistency and keep the pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a swarm of Merfolk creatures, buffed by Lords of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident. Using Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, along with disruptive cards like Harbinger of the Tides and Vapor Snag to control the board, the deck aims to create a fast, aggressive board presence while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Spreading Seas. Mutavault provides additional utility and versatility in combat situations.

This combo deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Search for Tomorrow, Farseek, and Simian Spirit Guide to cast Primeval Titan or Scapeshift to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Mountains. By sacrificing Sakura-Tribe Elder, players can trigger Valakut's ability to deal damage to opponents. Cards like Anger of the Gods help control the board while Chalice of the Void disrupts opponents' spells. Through the Breach and Summoner's Pact provide additional ways to cheat out Primeval Titan for a lethal Valakut combo.

This deck focuses on quickly putting powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Noble Hierarch and Eldrazi Temple, along with disruptive cards like Path to Exile and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to control the board and close out games before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of Eldrazi Displacer and Reality Smasher provides additional versatility and power to the deck, allowing for varied playstyles and strategies to secure victory.
